title: Ticket #2749: Any condor tool or daemon can get into an infinite loop on startup
description:
From time to time in new batlab, we see the cgahp-worker-thread stuck in an infinite loop consuming memory.

strace shows:

rename("/tmp/CGAHPWorkerLog.slot1.old", "/tmp/CGAHPWorkerLog.slot9.old") = -1 EPERM (Operation not permitted)

over and over again, even though this is running as slot9

Part of the problem is an off-by-one error in isLogFilename() in log_rotate.cpp. The third argument to the strncmp() is one too small. So when looking for log files of the form CGAHPLog.slot9.*, CGAHPLog.slot1.* will match.

Another part of the problem is that cleanUp() in log_rotate.cpp tries to eliminate extra old log files via calls to rotate_file(). If the rotate fails, cleanUp() loops indefinitely, calling dprintf() each time.
